verses.text: \w After|strong="H0310"\w* these \w things|strong="H1697"\w*, and the \w establishment|strong="H0571"\w* thereof, \w Sennacherib|strong="H5576"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Assyria|strong="H0804"\w* \w came|strong="H0935"\w*, and \w entered|strong="H0935"\w* into \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*, and \w encamped|strong="H2583"\w* against the \w fenced|strong="H1219"\w* \w cities|strong="H5892"\w*, and \w thought|strong="H0559"\w* to \w win|strong="H1234"\w* them for himself.\f + \fr 32.1 \ft to win…: Heb. to break them up\f*

And when \w Hezekiah|strong="H3169"\w* \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* that \w Sennacherib|strong="H5576"\w* was \w come|strong="H0935"\w*, and that he was \w purposed|strong="H6440"\w* to \w fight|strong="H4421"\w* against \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*,\f + \fr 32.2 \ft he was…: Heb. his face was to war\f*

He took \w counsel|strong="H3289"\w* with his \w princes|strong="H8269"\w* and his mighty \w men|strong="H1368"\w* to \w stop|strong="H5640"\w* the \w waters|strong="H4325"\w* of the \w fountains|strong="H5869"\w* which \add were\add* \w without|strong="H2351"\w* the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*: and they did \w help|strong="H5826"\w* him.

So there was \w gathered|strong="H6908"\w* \w much|strong="H7227"\w* \w people|strong="H5971"\w* \w together|strong="H6908"\w*, who \w stopped|strong="H5640"\w* all the \w fountains|strong="H4599"\w*, and the \w brook|strong="H5158"\w* that \w ran|strong="H7857"\w* through the \w midst|strong="H8432"\w* of the \w land|strong="H0776"\w*, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*, Why should the \w kings|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Assyria|strong="H0804"\w* \w come|strong="H0935"\w*, and \w find|strong="H4672"\w* \w much|strong="H7227"\w* \w water|strong="H4325"\w*?\f + \fr 32.4 \ft ran: Heb. overflowed\f*

Also he \w strengthened|strong="H2388"\w* himself, and built \w up|strong="H1129"\w* all the \w wall|strong="H2346"\w* that was \w broken|strong="H6555"\w*, and raised \add it\add* \w up|strong="H5927"\w* to the \w towers|strong="H4026"\w*, and \w another|strong="H0312"\w* \w wall|strong="H2346"\w* \w without|strong="H2351"\w*, and \w repaired|strong="H2388"\w* \w Millo|strong="H4407"\w* \add in\add* the \w city|strong="H5892"\w* of \w David|strong="H1732"\w*, and \w made|strong="H6213"\w* \w darts|strong="H7973"\w* and \w shields|strong="H4043"\w* in \w abundance|strong="H7230"\w*.\f + \fr 32.5 \ft darts: or, swords, or, weapons\f*

And he \w set|strong="H5414"\w* \w captains|strong="H8269"\w* of \w war|strong="H4421"\w* over the \w people|strong="H5971"\w*, and gathered them \w together|strong="H6908"\w* to him in the \w street|strong="H7339"\w* of the \w gate|strong="H8179"\w* of the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, and \w spake|strong="H1696"\w* \w comfortably|strong="H3824"\w* to them, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*,\f + \fr 32.6 \ft spake…: Heb. he spoke to their heart\f*

Be \w strong|strong="H2388"\w* and \w courageous|strong="H0553"\w*, be not \w afraid|strong="H3372"\w* nor \w dismayed|strong="H2865"\w* \w for|strong="H6440"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Assyria|strong="H0804"\w*, nor for all the \w multitude|strong="H1995"\w* that \add is\add* with him: for \add there be\add* \w more|strong="H7227"\w* with us than with him:

With him \add is\add* an \w arm|strong="H2220"\w* of \w flesh|strong="H1320"\w*; but with us \add is\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* our \w God|strong="H0430"\w* to \w help|strong="H5826"\w* us, and to \w fight|strong="H3898"\w* our \w battles|strong="H4421"\w*. And the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* \w rested|strong="H5564"\w* themselves upon the \w words|strong="H1697"\w* of \w Hezekiah|strong="H3169"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*.\f + \fr 32.8 \ft rested…: Heb. leaned\f*

¶ \w After|strong="H0310"\w* this did \w Sennacherib|strong="H5576"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Assyria|strong="H0804"\w* \w send|strong="H7971"\w* his \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* to \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*, (but he \add himself laid siege\add* against \w Lachish|strong="H3923"\w*, and all his \w power|strong="H4475"\w* with him,) unto \w Hezekiah|strong="H3169"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*, and unto all \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* that \add were\add* at \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*,\f + \fr 32.9 \ft power: Heb. dominion\f*

Thus \w saith|strong="H0559"\w* \w Sennacherib|strong="H5576"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Assyria|strong="H0804"\w*, Whereon do ye \w trust|strong="H0982"\w*, that ye \w abide|strong="H3427"\w* in the \w siege|strong="H4692"\w* in \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*?\f + \fr 32.10 \ft siege: or, strong hold\f*

Doth not \w Hezekiah|strong="H3169"\w* \w persuade|strong="H5496"\w* you to \w give|strong="H5414"\w* over yourselves to \w die|strong="H4191"\w* by \w famine|strong="H7458"\w* and by \w thirst|strong="H6772"\w*, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*, The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* our \w God|strong="H0430"\w* shall \w deliver|strong="H5337"\w* us out of the \w hand|strong="H3709"\w* of the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Assyria|strong="H0804"\w*?

Hath not the same \w Hezekiah|strong="H3169"\w* taken \w away|strong="H5493"\w* his high \w places|strong="H1116"\w* and his \w altars|strong="H4196"\w*, and \w commanded|strong="H0559"\w* \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* and \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*, Ye shall \w worship|strong="H7812"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* \w one|strong="H0259"\w* \w altar|strong="H4196"\w*, and burn \w incense|strong="H6999"\w* upon it?

\w Know|strong="H3045"\w* ye not what I and my \w fathers|strong="H0001"\w* have \w done|strong="H6213"\w* unto all the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* of \add other\add* \w lands|strong="H0776"\w*? were the \w gods|strong="H0430"\w* of the \w nations|strong="H1471"\w* of those \w lands|strong="H0776"\w* any \w ways|strong="H3201"\w* \w able|strong="H3201"\w* to \w deliver|strong="H5337"\w* their \w lands|strong="H0776"\w* out of mine \w hand|strong="H3027"\w*?

Who \add was there\add* among all the \w gods|strong="H0430"\w* of those \w nations|strong="H1471"\w* that my \w fathers|strong="H0001"\w* utterly \w destroyed|strong="H2763"\w*, that \w could|strong="H3201"\w* \w deliver|strong="H5337"\w* his \w people|strong="H5971"\w* out of mine \w hand|strong="H3027"\w*, that your \w God|strong="H0430"\w* should be \w able|strong="H3201"\w* to \w deliver|strong="H5337"\w* you out of mine \w hand|strong="H3027"\w*?

Now therefore let \w not|strong="H3808"\w* \w Hezekiah|strong="H2396"\w* \w deceive|strong="H5377"\w* you, nor \w persuade|strong="H5496"\w* you on this manner, neither yet \w believe|strong="H0539"\w* him: for no \w god|strong="H0433"\w* of any \w nation|strong="H1471"\w* or \w kingdom|strong="H4467"\w* was \w able|strong="H3201"\w* to \w deliver|strong="H5337"\w* his \w people|strong="H5971"\w* out of mine \w hand|strong="H3027"\w*, and out of the \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* of my \w fathers|strong="H0001"\w*: how much less shall your \w God|strong="H0430"\w* \w deliver|strong="H5337"\w* you out of mine \w hand|strong="H3027"\w*?

And his \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* \w spake|strong="H1696"\w* yet \add more\add* against the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \w God|strong="H0430"\w*, and against his \w servant|strong="H5650"\w* \w Hezekiah|strong="H3169"\w*.

He \w wrote|strong="H3789"\w* also \w letters|strong="H5612"\w* to \w rail|strong="H2778"\w* on the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \w God|strong="H0430"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, and to \w speak|strong="H0559"\w* against him, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*, As the \w gods|strong="H0430"\w* of the \w nations|strong="H1471"\w* of \add other\add* \w lands|strong="H0776"\w* have not \w delivered|strong="H5337"\w* their \w people|strong="H5971"\w* out of mine \w hand|strong="H3027"\w*, so shall not the \w God|strong="H0430"\w* of \w Hezekiah|strong="H3169"\w* \w deliver|strong="H5337"\w* his \w people|strong="H5971"\w* out of mine \w hand|strong="H3027"\w*.

Then they \w cried|strong="H7121"\w* with a \w loud|strong="H1419"\w* \w voice|strong="H6963"\w* in the \w Jews’ speech|strong="H3066"\w* unto the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* of \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* that \add were\add* on the \w wall|strong="H2346"\w*, to \w affright|strong="H3372"\w* them, and to \w trouble|strong="H0926"\w* them; that they might \w take|strong="H3920"\w* the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*.

And they \w spake|strong="H1696"\w* \w against|strong="H5921"\w* the \w God|strong="H0430"\w* of \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*, as against the \w gods|strong="H0430"\w* of the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* of the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w*, \add which were\add* the \w work|strong="H4639"\w* of the \w hands|strong="H3027"\w* of \w man|strong="H0120"\w*.

And for this \add cause\add* \w Hezekiah|strong="H3169"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, and the \w prophet|strong="H5030"\w* \w Isaiah|strong="H3470"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Amoz|strong="H0531"\w*, \w prayed|strong="H6419"\w* and \w cried|strong="H2199"\w* to \w heaven|strong="H8064"\w*.

¶ And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* an \w angel|strong="H4397"\w*, which cut \w off|strong="H3582"\w* all the mighty \w men|strong="H1368"\w* of \w valour|strong="H2428"\w*, and the \w leaders|strong="H5057"\w* and \w captains|strong="H8269"\w* in the \w camp|strong="H4264"\w* of the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Assyria|strong="H0804"\w*. So he \w returned|strong="H7725"\w* with \w shame|strong="H1322"\w* of \w face|strong="H6440"\w* to his own \w land|strong="H0776"\w*. And when he was \w come|strong="H0935"\w* into the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of his \w god|strong="H0430"\w*, they that came \w forth|strong="H3329"\w* of his own \w bowels|strong="H4578"\w* \w slew|strong="H5307"\w* him there with the \w sword|strong="H2719"\w*.\f + \fr 32.21 \ft slew…: Heb. made him fall\f*

Thus the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \w saved|strong="H3467"\w* \w Hezekiah|strong="H3169"\w* and the \w inhabitants|strong="H3427"\w* of \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* from the \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* of \w Sennacherib|strong="H5576"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Assyria|strong="H0804"\w*, and from the \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* of all \add other\add*, and \w guided|strong="H5095"\w* them on every \w side|strong="H5439"\w*.

And \w many|strong="H7227"\w* \w brought|strong="H0935"\w* \w gifts|strong="H4503"\w* unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* to \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*, and \w presents|strong="H4030"\w* to \w Hezekiah|strong="H3169"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*: so that he was \w magnified|strong="H5375"\w* in the \w sight|strong="H5869"\w* of all \w nations|strong="H1471"\w* from \w thenceforth|strong="H0310"\w*.\f + \fr 32.23 \ft presents: Heb. precious things\f*

¶ In those \w days|strong="H3117"\w* \w Hezekiah|strong="H3169"\w* was \w sick|strong="H2470"\w* to the \w death|strong="H4191"\w*, and \w prayed|strong="H6419"\w* unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: and he \w spake|strong="H0559"\w* unto him, and he \w gave|strong="H5414"\w* him a \w sign|strong="H4159"\w*.\f + \fr 32.24 \ft gave…: or, wrought a miracle for him\f*

But \w Hezekiah|strong="H3169"\w* rendered not \w again|strong="H7725"\w* according to the \w benefit|strong="H1576"\w* \add done\add* unto him; for his \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* was lifted \w up|strong="H1361"\w*: therefore there was \w wrath|strong="H7110"\w* upon him, and upon \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* and \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*.

Notwithstanding \w Hezekiah|strong="H3169"\w* \w humbled|strong="H3665"\w* himself for the \w pride|strong="H1363"\w* of his \w heart|strong="H3820"\w*, \add both\add* he and the \w inhabitants|strong="H3427"\w* of \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*, so that the \w wrath|strong="H7110"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \w came|strong="H0935"\w* not upon them in the \w days|strong="H3117"\w* of \w Hezekiah|strong="H3169"\w*.\f + \fr 32.26 \ft pride: Heb. lifting up\f*

¶ And \w Hezekiah|strong="H3169"\w* had \w exceeding|strong="H3966"\w* \w much|strong="H7235"\w* \w riches|strong="H6239"\w* and \w honour|strong="H3519"\w*: and he \w made|strong="H6213"\w* himself \w treasuries|strong="H0214"\w* for \w silver|strong="H3701"\w*, and for \w gold|strong="H2091"\w*, and for \w precious|strong="H3368"\w* \w stones|strong="H0068"\w*, and for \w spices|strong="H1314"\w*, and for \w shields|strong="H4043"\w*, and for all manner of \w pleasant|strong="H2532"\w* \w jewels|strong="H3627"\w*;\f + \fr 32.27 \ft pleasant…: Heb. instruments of desire\f*

\w Storehouses|strong="H4543"\w* also for the \w increase|strong="H8393"\w* of \w corn|strong="H1715"\w*, and \w wine|strong="H8492"\w*, and \w oil|strong="H3323"\w*; and \w stalls|strong="H0723"\w* for all manner of \w beasts|strong="H0929"\w*, and \w cotes|strong="H0220"\w* for \w flocks|strong="H5739"\w*.

Moreover he \w provided|strong="H6213"\w* him \w cities|strong="H5892"\w*, and \w possessions|strong="H4735"\w* of \w flocks|strong="H6629"\w* and \w herds|strong="H1241"\w* in \w abundance|strong="H7230"\w*: for \w God|strong="H0430"\w* had \w given|strong="H5414"\w* him \w substance|strong="H7399"\w* \w very|strong="H3966"\w* \w much|strong="H7227"\w*.

This same \w Hezekiah|strong="H3169"\w* also \w stopped|strong="H5640"\w* the \w upper|strong="H5945"\w* \w watercourse|strong="H4161"\w* of \w Gihon|strong="H1521"\w*, and brought it \w straight|strong="H3474"\w* \w down|strong="H4295"\w* to the west \w side|strong="H4628"\w* of the \w city|strong="H5892"\w* of \w David|strong="H1732"\w*. And \w Hezekiah|strong="H3169"\w* \w prospered|strong="H6743"\w* in all his \w works|strong="H4639"\w*.

¶ \w Howbeit|strong="H3651"\w* in \add the business of\add* the \w ambassadors|strong="H3887"\w* of the \w princes|strong="H8269"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w*, who \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* unto him to \w enquire|strong="H1875"\w* of the \w wonder|strong="H4159"\w* that was \add done\add* in the \w land|strong="H0776"\w*, \w God|strong="H0430"\w* \w left|strong="H5800"\w* him, to \w try|strong="H5254"\w* him, that he might \w know|strong="H3045"\w* all \add that was\add* in his \w heart|strong="H3824"\w*.\f + \fr 32.31 \ft ambassadors: Heb. interpreters\f*

¶ Now the \w rest|strong="H3499"\w* of the \w acts|strong="H1697"\w* of \w Hezekiah|strong="H3169"\w*, and his \w goodness|strong="H2617"\w*, behold, they \add are\add* \w written|strong="H3789"\w* in the \w vision|strong="H2377"\w* of \w Isaiah|strong="H3470"\w* the \w prophet|strong="H5030"\w*, the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Amoz|strong="H0531"\w*, \add and\add* in the \w book|strong="H5612"\w* of the \w kings|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* and \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*.\f + \fr 32.32 \ft goodness: Heb. kindnesses\f*

And \w Hezekiah|strong="H3169"\w* \w slept|strong="H7901"\w* with his \w fathers|strong="H0001"\w*, and they \w buried|strong="H6912"\w* him in the \w chiefest|strong="H4608"\w* of the \w sepulchres|strong="H6913"\w* of the \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* of \w David|strong="H1732"\w*: and all \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* and the \w inhabitants|strong="H3427"\w* of \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* did \w him|strong="H6213"\w* \w honour|strong="H3519"\w* at his \w death|strong="H4194"\w*. And \w Manasseh|strong="H4519"\w* his \w son|strong="H1121"\w* \w reigned|strong="H4427"\w* in his stead.\f + \fr 32.33 \ft chiefest: or, highest\f*
